thread.title: Five players from Texas universities selected to Naismith watch lists
thread.title_full: Five players from Texas universities selected to Naismith watch lists - San Antonio Express-News

author: Nick Moyle
title: Five players from Texas universities selected to Naismith watch lists
text:
Photo: Cooper Neill, Getty Images Image 1 of / 4 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 4 Taurean Prince, Baylor, SF/PF
2014-2015 Stats
PPG : 13.9 RPG : 5.6 PER : 25.6 3P %: .395
A former standout at Warren High School, Prince, along with Rico Gathers, was the driving force behind Baylor's 24-10 record last season. Now entering his senior year, Prince's buttery shooting stroke is poised to carry a talented Baylor deep into March.
Photo: Cooper Neill, Getty Images Taurean Prince, Baylor, SF/PF
2014-2015 Stats
PPG : 13.9 RPG : 5.6 PER :... Image 2 of 4 Rico Gathers, Baylor, PF
2014-2015 Stats
PPG: 11.6 RPG: 11.6 PER: 25.6 BPG: 1.0
The thunder to Prince's lightning, Gathers is the second half of Baylor's dynamic duo of senior stars. Though just 6-foot-8, Gather's hulking 275-pound frame is a load most collegiate players can't handle. Once again, Gathers will be relied on to dominate the paint on both sides of the floor.
Photo: Rod Aydelotte, Associated Press Rico Gathers, Baylor, PF
2014-2015 Stats
PPG: 11.6 RPG: 11.6 PER:. .. Image 3 of 4 Danuel House, Texas A&M, SG
2014-2015 Stats
PPG : 14.8 APG : 2.1 PER : 17.9 3P% : .400
House brings to mind Jamal Crawford — without the Rucker Park dribbling skills. The Houston transfer has no fear gunning from deep or pulling up off the dribble, and when all facets of his game are working he's a lock for 20-plus points.
His issue is consistency, but as a fifth-year senior, the Aggies hope he can alleviate those ills and get A&M back to the NCAA Tournament for the first time since 2011.
Photo: Brett Coomer, Houston Chronicle Danuel House, Texas A&M, SG
2014-2015 Stats
PPG : 14.8 APG : 2.1 PER :... Image 4 of 4 D.J. Hogg, Texas A&M, SF
If Hogg's final high school moment is any indication of what's the come, the Aggies are in for a treat. Hogg's last shot as a senior at Plano West was an 18-foot buzzer-beater to capture the UIL 6A state title.
Everyone in College Station hopes that moment is a harbinger of things to come for the 6-foot-8 Aggie commit with a silky stroke and budding baby 'fro.
Photo: Tom Reel / San Antonio Express-News D.J. Hogg, Texas A&M, SF
If Hogg's final high school moment is any... Five players from Texas universities selected to Naismith watch lists 1 / 4 Back to Gallery The Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame announced finalists for its four position-based awards on Tuesday.
Of the 80 finalists — 20 for each award — five hail from Texas universities.
Texas A&M's Danuel House is a finalist for the Jerry West Shooting Guard of the Year Award.
His teammate, D.J. Hogg, is up for the Julius Erving Small Forward of the Year Award.
Not to be outdone, Baylor has two Bears representing the school, Rico Gathers and Taurean Prince, both of whom are finalists for the Karl Malone Power Forward of the Year Award.
Joining the two Bears on the Malone watch list is SMU power forward Markus Kennedy.
The Longhorns don't have any reps, but did add a trio of promising freshmen: Kerwin Roach, Eric Davis and Tevin Mack.
The college basketball season tips off Nov. 13.
